headline: PepsiCo Earnings Need to Show Its Turnaround Is Gaining Traction
summary: When  PepsiCo  reports its latest quarterly results Tuesday morning, investors will look for evidence the company’s efforts to reignite growth and protect margins in the U.S. are beginning to show.  For the fourth quarter ended in December, analysts polled by FactSet expect PepsiCo to post $2.24 in earnings per share, compared with $1.96 a year ago—marking the first year-over-year growth in three quarters.  While PepsiCo’s headline revenue showed year-over-year gains in the past two quarters, much of that growth came from international markets.

headline: IBM Deepens Enterprise AI Push As Board Adds PepsiCo Chief
summary: IBM (NYSE:IBM) has expanded its AI offerings with new asset-based consulting services, including the Enterprise Advantage platform for governed, multi-cloud AI deployment. The company announced a collaboration with e& to roll out agentic AI at scale for enterprises in regulated sectors. IBM also appointed Ramon L. Laguarta, CEO of PepsiCo, to its board, adding an experienced transformation-focused executive to its governance structure. IBM, trading at $306.7, sits at the center of the...

headline: PepsiCo Leadership Moves And Valuation Signals For NasdaqGS PEP Investors
summary: PepsiCo CEO Ramon Laguarta has been appointed to IBM's board of directors, expanding his responsibilities beyond the beverage and snacks group. PepsiCo has named Savitha Balachandran as Chief Financial Officer for India and South Asia, marking a leadership change in that regional business. These appointments highlight PepsiCo's focus on leadership depth across its global operations and its presence in wider corporate governance circles. For investors tracking NasdaqGS:PEP, these leadership...
